meanings.definition: To reduce to small particles or fragments.
meanings.sent1: I will comminute the bread into crumbs for the recipe.
meanings.sent2: The blender can easily comminute the ice into a smoothie.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally comminuted the paper into confetti while trying to cut it.
meanings.sent4: The artist's brush strokes seemed to comminute the colors into a beautiful mosaic.
meanings.sent5: The strong winds comminuted the sand into tiny grains that flew everywhere.

meanings.definition: To pulverize or crush into fine particles.
meanings.sent1: The machine will comminute the rocks into sand for construction.
meanings.sent2: She used a mortar and pestle to comminute the spices into a powder.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally comminuted the garlic into a cloud of dust while chopping.
meanings.sent4: The earthquake seemed to comminute the buildings into rubble in seconds.
meanings.sent5: The intense pressure can comminute coal into diamonds over time.
